programme.title: Sky
programme.desc: A Parisian woman (Diane Kruger) embarks on a life-changing trip through the California desert after breaking up with her boorish husband (Gilles Lellouche).

programme.title: Bare
programme.desc: A young woman's (Dianna Agron) friendship with a drug-dealing drifter (Paz de la Huerta) evolves into a lesbian romance.

programme.title: The Loneliest Planet
programme.desc: An incident on the trail tests two lovers' (Gael García Bernal, Hani Furstenberg) relationship as they take a guided hiking tour through the Caucasus Mountains.

programme.title: Una noche
programme.desc: Raul dreams of escaping to Miami. When he is accused of assault, he convinces his friend Elio to help him cross the ocean.

programme.title: Every Thing Will Be Fine
programme.desc: After he causes a car accident, Tomas (James Franco) spends the next 12 years examining the effects of the tragedy on his life.

programme.title: Premature
programme.desc: On a summer night in Harlem during her last months at home before starting college, 17-year-old poet Ayanna begins a summer romance with Isaiah, a music producer who has just moved to the city.

programme.title: The Imperialists Are Still Alive!
programme.desc: A French party girl (Élodie Bouchez) in Manhattan finds romance on the same night she learns that her childhood friend has disappeared.

programme.title: The Best Offer
programme.desc: Virgil Oldman (Geoffrey Rush), the director of an esteemed auction house, falls in love with a reclusive young heiress. After he shows her his priceless collection of portraits, she soon disappears with all of his paintings.

programme.title: Red Hook Summer
programme.desc: A well-to-do Atlanta teen (Jules Brown) documents a summer spent in the Brooklyn housing projects with his devout grandfather (Clarke Peters).

programme.title: Vita & Virginia
programme.desc: A love affair develops between author Vita Sackville-West and literary icon Virginia Woolf, inspiring one of Woolf's greatest works.

programme.title: The Loneliest Planet
programme.desc: An incident on the trail tests two lovers' (Gael García Bernal, Hani Furstenberg) relationship as they take a guided hiking tour through the Caucasus Mountains.

programme.title: Far North
programme.desc: A soldier interrupts the simple lives of two women.

programme.title: Boyhood
programme.desc: A youngster (Ellar Coltrane) makes the long journey to adulthood over the span of 12 years, as he, his sister (Lorelei Linklater) and his mother (Patricia Arquette) move around Texas.
